description: gray; black push-buttons on underside of hand-set with hang-up lever above; hand-set rectangular in shape; black cord; separate wall holder is horizontal with triangular raised point on L end where hand-set attaches and hangs vertically; red, raised triangle on R end; housed in original packaging box, triangular in shape; wall mounting hardware in box
text: Minimalism applied to telephone technology - no effort is made to dress up this severe right-angle form reminiscent of the Russian Constructivists such as El Lissitzky and Kasimir Malevitch at their most austere.  It embodies a formal purity with the visual language of functionalism.  Special features include a last number re-dial and a ten-number automatic dial.
title: "Kirk Plus" push-button telephone
